Note:

page.text: 1. † Indicates translated version of the question.
2. Indicates a question for oral reply.
3. ■ Indicates a written question transferred for oral reply upon the request of the relevant
member (Rule 117).
4. ◙ Indicates a question for written reply not yet replied to after 10 working days have
expired.

text.b: Table of Contents

page.text: Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs ................................................ 706, 709
Minister in the Presidency: National Planning Commission ............................................................ 710
Minister in the Presidency: Performance Monitoring and Evaluation as well as
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 700
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN REPLY
THURSDAY, 8 AUGUST 2013
Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: Who is the contractor who performed welding of inferior quality on the boilers at the
Medupi power plant;
whether any continuous inspections of the welding on the boilers was done by (a)
Eskom and (b) Hitachi; if not, why not; if so, why was the inferior quality of the
welding not addressed;
(3) what steps have been or are being taken against the contractor who produced
welding of inferior quality;
when will the Medupi power plant be operational for the first output of electricity;
whether he will make a statement on the matter?
NW2306E

text.b: Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:†

page.text: With reference to her reply to question 2760 on 13 December 2010, (a) how many of
the 250 kg bombs that displayed crystallisation were destroyed, (b)(i) what calibre of
ammunition is kept in 93 Ammunition Depot at Jan Kempdorp, where the explosives
are probably in a phase of crystallisation, and (ii) how much of this type of
ammunition is there in the depot, (c) on what date was this ammunition
manufactured and (d) what steps will be taken to protect the lives of those members
who will have to destroy this ammunition;
(2) whether the licences of any more magazines have been restricted because the
informal settlement at Jan Kempdorp has developed to within the original danger
zones; if so, (a) how many magazines, (b) by how many kilograms the licence for
each separate magazine has been reduced and (c) what is the distance from the
nearest informal settlement to the border of the depot;
whether all of the depot’s lightning conductors are serviced annually; if not, why not;
if so, how many of the conductors of magazines (a) have been fully serviced and (b)
have yet to be serviced this year;
whether (a) all of the roofs have been repaired and (b) any of the magazine roofs are
leaking; if so, in each case, (i) how many and (ii) what steps are being taken to repair
the leaks;
whether she will make a statement on the matter?
NW2307E
701 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land
Reform:

page.text: With reference to his reply to question 1540 on 23 July 2013, what amount has the
Government paid in compensation for the loss of land in each financial year since the
start of its programme in respect of restitution of land to beneficiaries;
how many hectares of land will be given back to beneficiaries in each financial year
in terms of the programme regarding the restitution of land in instances where
financial compensation is not accepted?
NW2308E

text.b: Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: What (a) is the maximum period for the deployment of police officers to other countries
for peacekeeping purposes and (b) was the total cost of such deployments in the (i) 2010-
11, (ii) 2011-12 and (iii) 2012-13 financial years?
NW2326E

text.b: Mr R N Cebekhulu (IFP) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: (1) What are the effects of genetic engineering on biodiversity through gene flow
modified crops;
(2) whether any long-term research is being conducted into the effects of genetic
engineering on (a)(i) human and (ii) animal health and (b) the environment;
whether her department is applying the precautionary principle and adopting policy
which promotes organic farming practices;
(4) whether her department supports research into methods of reducing the impact of
agriculture on the environment;
(5) whether she can elaborate on the health problems that are associated with the
herbicides (a) glufosinate and (b) glyphosate they want to use?
NW2331E

text.b: Mr K P Sithole (IFP) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:

page.text: What are the full names of the ward councillors arrested for selling Reconstruction
and Development (RDP) houses;
whether her department has a strategy to speed up the application process for RDP
houses; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW2332E

text.b: 1977. Mr R N Cebekhulu (IFP) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land
Reform:

page.text: How much did his department spend on (a) reviving irrigation schemes in all districts and
(b) rejuvenating the Ncora Irrigation Scheme in Engcobo?
NW2333E
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 702
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mrs H S Msweli (IFP) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: How many clinics has he found to be performing illegal abortions in each province;
(a) how many clinics performing illegal abortions has his department closed and (b)
what are the relevant details in each case?
NW2334E

text.b: Mr M Hlengwa (IFP) to ask the Minister of Sport and Recreation:

page.text: (a) How many athletes have been tested for using banned substances to enhance their
performance in the past three years and (b) how many have tested positive for the use of
these substances?
NW2335E

text.b: Mr M Hlengwa (IFP) to ask the Minister of Mineral Resources:

page.text: (1) What progress has been made by the Mining Occupational Health Advisory
Committee (MOHAC) in ensuring safety in mines;
how many persons in rural areas have benefited from small scale mining projects?
NW2336E

text.b: Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: Whether there was an independent investigation into a certain person (details
furnished); if so, (a) on what basis was it instituted and (b) what were the allegations;
whether a final report of the investigation was compiled; if so, (a) when and (b)
when did he receive the report;
what are the (a) findings and (b) recommendations of the report;
when will the report be made public;
what (a) actions will be taken based on the report and (b) are the reasons for any
action or recommendation not to be taken?
NW2337E

text.b: Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: How will (a) the Department of Military Veterans maintain its infrastructure, including (i)
memorial and (ii) heritage sites and (b) this department maintain the specified sites beyond
the Medium Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF) period?
NW2338E

text.b: Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: What (a) services has the Department of Military Veterans put out to tender by private
sector companies for the period 2013-14 and (b) service level agreements exist in this
regard?
NW2339E
703 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: (a) How did the Department of Military Veterans assist 100 military veterans to obtain
certificates approved by the SA Qualifications Authority (SAQA) in the 2012-13 financial
year and (b) what plans are in place to reach the target of 1000 in the 2013-14 financial
year?
NW2340E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: How many (a) child pornography websites have been closed down in the (i) 2010-11, (ii)
2011-12 and (iii) 2012-13 financial years and (b) persons were convicted in each case?
NW2341E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: Are the names of same-sex couples that have adopted a child included on that child’s birth
certificate?
NW2342E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: (a) Which of our embassies abroad have fast-track desks and (b) what mechanisms exist
for skilled persons interested in coming to South Africa?
NW2343E

text.b: Mr J Selfe (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: How many crimes committed at the Wynberg Military Base have been reported in
each specified calendar year since 1 January 2009;
in respect of each specified crime, what (a) was the nature of the crime, (b) action
was taken and (c) was the outcome of the action;
(3) whether the base has (a) 24-hour access control, (b) perimeter security and (c) a
crime prevention plan; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details in each
case;
(4) has the perimeter fence ever been breached; if so, how much has been spent on the
maintenance and repair of this fence in each specified calendar year since 1 January
NW2344E

text.b: Ms D Kohler-Barnard (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: (a) How many people have been arrested for the illegal possession of narcotics at
each port of entry in each province in the (i) 2010-11, (ii) 2011-12 and (iii) 2012-13
financial years and (b) in each case, (i) which narcotics were they in possession of
and (ii) what was the total quantity thereof confiscated by the SA Police Service;
(a) how many people have been arrested for any other reason at each port of entry in
each province in the (i) 2010-11, (ii) 2011-12 and (iii) 2012-13 financial years and
(b) in each case what was the reason for the arrest?
NW2345E
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 704
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Ms D Kohler-Barnard (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: What was the total amount of narcotics seized by the SA Police Service (SAPS) in
the (a) 2010-11, (b) 2011-12 and (c) 2012-13 financial years;
(2) whether any of the narcotics that were seized by the SAPS in these years have
subsequently gone missing; if so, (a) how much and (b) how many SAPS members
faced disciplinary action as a result?
NW2346E

text.b: Ms D Kohler-Barnard (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: Whether pregnant officers of the SA Police Service are provided with uniforms for every
stage of pregnancy for the duration of the pregnancy while on duty; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
NW2347E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: (a) How many soldiers are currently stationed along each land border in each province and
(b) in respect of each of these soldiers, (i) how many have been charged with misconduct
and (ii) what (aa) was the nature of the misconduct and (bb) subsequent disciplinary action
has been taken?
NW2348E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: How many soldiers are currently stationed to patrol each land border in each province by
(a) foot and (b) mobile patrol?
NW2349E

text.b: Mrs A Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: What is the average length of time it takes to process an application for the rezoning
of agricultural land;
(a) how many applications (i) for rezoning of agricultural land has her department
received in each year since 2009 and (ii) have not yet been finalised and (b) what is
the reason for the delay in each case?
NW2350E

text.b: Mr J Selfe (DA) to ask the Minister of Correctional Services:

page.text: How many inmates in each specified correctional centre (a) qualified for parole and (b)
were placed on parole in the (i) 2010-11, (ii) 2011-12 and (iii) 2012-13 financial years?
NW2351E

text.b: Mr J Selfe (DA) to ask the Minister of Correctional Services:

page.text: (a) At how many correctional facilities has the Adult Education and Training (ABET)
programme been rolled out since 1 April 2013, (b) how many inmates have been enrolled
in the programme to date and (c) how many additional staff members have been employed
at each specified correctional centre in this regard?
NW2352E
705 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: What amount was allocated by her department in the (a) 2011-12, (b) 2012-13 and (c)
2013-14 financial years for the provision of food parcels?
NW2353E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: (1) How many helicopter (a) flights and (b) ferry flights have been undertaken by
transporting the President from (i) Durban International Airport and/or (ii) King
Shaka International Airport to his private residence in Nkandla (aa) in the (aaa)
2009-10, (bbb) 2010-11, (ccc) 2011-12 and (ddd) 2012-13 financial years and (bb)
since 1 April 2013;
what is the (a) total cost and (b) breakdown of such cost for the helicopter (i) flights
and (ii) ferry flights in each of the specified financial years?
NW2354E

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: (1) What are the full details of the rationale for her decision to continue the
administrative intervention in the Limpopo Department of Education in terms of
section 100(1)(b) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996;
what change(s) in the current circumstances in Limpopo will result in a decision to
recommend the termination of the intervention;
(3) what are the full details of the rationale for her decision to change the level of
administrative intervention in the Eastern Cape Department of Education from that
provided for in section 100(1)(b) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa,
1996, to that provided for in section 100(1)(a);
by what date does she anticipate that the altered level of intervention will come into
effect;
what recourse is available to her to enforce compliance with section 100(1)(a) of the
Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996?
NW2355E

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether all persons employed to mark National Senior Certificate examination papers in
2013 will be required to undergo a competency test; if not, why not; if so, what are the
relevant details of the (a) planned testing and (b) action(s) following the testing?
NW2356E
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 706
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether she requested the Public Service Commission (PSC) to investigate the conduct of
her department’s Director-General, as required under the heading Decision of the President
in the Report of the Presidential Task Team established to investigate the non-delivery
and/or delays in the delivery of Learner Teacher Support Material in Limpopo schools in
the 2012 school year; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details of the PSC
investigation, including action taken or action to be taken based on the findings?
NW2357E

text.b: The Leader of the Opposition (DA) to ask the President of the Republic:

page.text: Why was the Deputy President removed as chairperson of the National Nuclear Energy
Executive Coordinating Committee?
NW2358E

text.b: The Leader of the Opposition (DA) to ask the Deputy President:

page.text: Whether he was informed of the reasons for his removal as chairperson of the National
Nuclear Energy Executive Coordinating Committee; if so, what were the reasons?
NW2359E

text.b: Mr J F Smalle (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: (a) How many times this year has he met with employees of a certain organisation
(name furnished), (b) what was discussed at each meeting, (c) when was each
meeting held and (d) where was each meeting held;
whether more meetings will be held; if so, (a) when will the meetings be held and (b)
what will be discussed at these meetings?
NW2360E

text.b: Ms A M Dreyer (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: What steps have been taken to address the security threat at the President’s official
residence, King’s House, in Durban, specifically with reference to the growth of the
bamboo bush outside the property’s security fence which falls inside the property’s
perimeter?
NW2361E

text.b: 2006. Mr J H Steenhuisen (DA) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: (1) How many (a) municipal managers and (b) senior municipal managers in each
specified municipality have (i) complied and (ii) failed to comply with the January
2013 deadline for attaining the minimum competency levels;
(2) what is the breakdown of the number of (a) municipal managers and (b) senior
municipal managers in each specified municipality who failed to comply with the
January 2013 deadline for attaining the minimum competency levels who have
applied in writing for the 18-month extension;
707 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013
what will the consequences be for those municipal managers and senior municipal
managers who have (a) not complied and (b) not been granted the 18-month
extension?
NW2363E

text.b: Mr J F Smalle (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: (1) Is he still committed to the National Development Plan's strategy for a nuclear
programme by 2023;
by when does he intend to add additional nuclear power to the grid?
NW2364E

text.b: Mr I M Ollis (DA) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: Whether the SA National Roads Agency Limited (Sanral) is part of the International
Bridge, Tunnel and Turnpike Association (IBTTA); if so, (a) why was it not included in
the Minister's reply to question 1519 on 27 June 2013 and (b) what are the (i) yearly costs
and (ii) benefits of membership; if not, how could Sanral win an award as nonmember of
the IBTTA?
NW2365E

text.b: Mr J J McGluwa (ID) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance Monitoring
and Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: (1) Why, in each case, has the (a) chief executive officer (CEO), (b) chief operations
officer (COO) and (c) Manager for Corporate Services at the National Youth
Development Agency (NYDA) been suspended;
(2) whether formal disciplinary charges have been instituted against the (a) CEO, (b)
COO or (c) Manager for Corporate Services at the NYDA; if so, on what grounds
have disciplinary hearings been instituted in each case;
whether the (a) CEO, (b) COO and (c) Manager for Corporate Services at the NYDA
have been accused of any form of financial mismanagement or misconduct; if so,
have formal investigations into this mismanagement or misconduct been initiated in
each specified case;
whether the (a) CEO, (b) COO and (c) Manager for Corporate Services at the NYDA
are still receiving salaries after their respective suspensions; if so, what is the salary
that is being paid in each specified case?
NW2366E

text.b: The Leader of the Opposition (DA) to ask the President of the Republic:

page.text: (1) What criteria does he use to determine if a foreign state has had a free and fair
election;
how did he factor in the irregularities identified by the African Union regarding the
election in the Republic of Zimbabwe before congratulating Mr Robert Mugabe on
winning the election;
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 708
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013
(a) at what time before the start of the elections is inspection of the voters roll too
late for the election to be free and fair in the Republic of Zimbabwe and (b) how
many (i) more voters that were turned away from the voting stations determines the
election not to be free and fair and (ii) extra ballots printed is necessary to determine
the Republic of Zimbabwe’s election to be unfair;
why does the Government’s position on the fairness of the election in the Republic
of Zimbabwe differ from the position held by the (a) European Union, (b)
Commonwealth of Australia, (c) United Kingdom and (d) United States of America;
Since the beginning of his term as President, which foreign elections in which the
Government had played a role has he considered not to be free and fair?
NW2367E

text.b: Mrs C Dudley (ACDP) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: With reference to her reply to question 2521 on 18 October 2012, (a) whom did her
department contact during their extensive consultation process on the development of a
policy on homeschooling, (b) who does her department recognise as the elected
representatives of the organised homeschooling community and (c) was this organisation
contacted during the specified consultation process; if not, why not; if so, what are the
relevant details?
NW2368E

text.b: Mr N J J van R Koornhof (Cope) to ask the Minister of Water and Environmental
Affairs:

page.text: (a) What amount will be spent on the upgrading of existing facilities in the camps in the
Kruger National Park and (b) which camps will be upgraded?
NW2370E

text.b: Mr D A Kganare (Cope) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: (a) How many (i) farms were visited by labour inspectors in the 2012-13 financial year and
(ii) of these visits were follow-up visits and (b) what are the top five main issues that were
identified by the labour inspectors?
NW2371E

text.b: Mr D A Kganare (Cope) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: (1) Why is there such a difference in the state of the R34 from Memel to Newcastle
between the section in the Free State and the section in KwaZulu-Natal;
whether her department has the budget to rebuild this road; if not, why not?
NW2372E

text.b: Mr D A Kganare (Cope) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: What amount was (a) budgeted for the revitalisation of the Moses Kotane Hospital,
(b) spent in total, (c) paid to each contractor which was appointed to build the
hospital and (d) recovered from the first contractor who was removed from the site;
709 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013
whether any action has been taken against the second contractor to repair structural
deficiencies at this hospital; if not, why not; if so, what action?
NW2373E

text.b: Mr N J J van R Koornhof (Cope) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: Whether the Cape Town International Airport intends extending the landing facilities to
accommodate the landing of the Airbus A380; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant
details?
NW2374E

text.b: 2017. Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: (1) Whether he has been informed of the ongoing billing crisis in the City of
Johannesburg Metropolitan Municipality; if not, what is the position in this regard; if
so, what interventions have been made;
whether his department has been informed of the cause for the billing crisis; if not,
what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the details;
whether (a) a certain household (details furnished) was served with a final notice in
the first week of August 2013 and (b) the headquarters of the ANC, Luthuli House,
was served with an incorrect bill dated 24 May 2013; if so, how was each matter
resolved;
(4) whether the said metro has implemented all the necessary measures to restore the
integrity of the billing system; if not, what corrective measures will his department
implement to assist the metro; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW2375E

text.b: Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether her department, in terms of the Government's responsibility with regard to
no-fee schools, maintains the records of schoolgoing children of (a) citizens as well
as (b) noncitizens for planning and budgeting purposes; if not, why not; if so,
(2) what (a) was the ratio of children of citizens to children of noncitizens in the (i)
2011-12 and (ii) 2012-13 financial years and (b) is the ratio currently;
whether her department can provide a provincial breakdown of the data for the (a)
2010-11, (b) 2011-12 and (c) 2012-13 financial years; if not, why not;
(a) what are the estimated costs per learner in (i) primary and (ii) secondary schools
for the current financial year and (b) how do the figures compare to the costs per
learner in the (i) 2011-12 and (ii) 2012-13 financial years;
Thursday, 8 August 2013] 710
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013
whether her department has found that the trend of migration to South Africa will
jeopardise the Government's ability to improve school infrastructure and the quality
of education to the poorest quintile in the primary and secondary school sector; if
not, what is the position in this regard; if so, how does she intend to implement
corrective steps?
NW2376E

text.b: Adv A de W Alberts (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:†

page.text: Whether, in the light of less and less industries buying electricity from Eskom, he
has found that, notwithstanding the implementation of the Industrial Policy Action
Plan (IPAP), the economy is currently de-industrialising; if so, what steps is he
planning to take so as to counter de-industrialisation; if not, what indications are
there that industrialisation is working?
NW2377E

text.b: 2020. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: With reference to the Public Administration Leadership and Management Academy
(Palama), what (a) is the state of readiness and (b) implementation procedures are in
place to enhance the training and development of public servants to improve
productivity;
(2) (a) what are the criteria for interns and (b) will Palama be able to deal with this
demand; if not, what steps will she take to deal with this matter;
(a) will senior management personnel in various departments be used to facilitate the
training of educational staff and (b) what criteria will be used to employ experts to
lecture on subject matters?
NW2382E

text.b: 2021. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: What (a) progress has been made with the establishment of the new Corruption Bureau, (b)
capacity is needed to make this bureau functional and (c) skills are needed for appointment
as (i) head of the bureau and (ii) staff to manage the bureau?
NW2383E

text.b: Mrs M Wenger (DA) to ask the Deputy President:

page.text: What was the (a) make, (b) model, (c) year, (d) purpose, (e) date and/or dates, (f) financial
cost and (g) sum total of kilometres driven in respect of each vehicle hired for use by him
since 1 January 2012?
NW2430E

text.b: 2023. Mrs M Wenger (DA) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: National Planning
Commission:

page.text: What was the (a) make, (b) model, (c) year, (d) purpose, (e) date and/or dates, (f) financial
cost and (g) sum total of kilometres driven in respect of each vehicle hired for use by him
since 1 January 2012?
NW2431E
711 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013

text.b: Mrs M Wenger (DA) to ask the President of the Republic:

page.text: What was the (a) make, (b) model, (c) year, (d) purpose, (e) date and/or dates, (f) financial
cost and (g) sum total of kilometres driven in respect of each vehicle hired for use by him
since 1 January 2012?
NW2432E

text.b: 1735. Mr J H Steenhuisen (DA) to ask the Minister for Rural Development and Land
Reform: [Interdepartmental transfer on 8 August 2013]

page.text: Have any amakhosi benefitted from the sale or leasing of land held by the
Ingonyama Trust Board; if so, what are the relevant details;
721 [Thursday, 8 August 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 25─2013
what is the current balance held in each of the Ingonyama Trust Board accounts;
(a) what projects have been delivered by the Ingonyama Trust Board in the (i)
and (b) what was the value of each of the projects;
what laws and regulations are used to (a) dispose of and (b) lease properties and
land held by (i) the Ingonyama Trust and (ii) traditional tribal authorities;
how are decisions made on the use of the moneys held by the (a) Ingonyama Trust
and (b) traditional authorities?
NW2082E
